{{infobox character | people=[[Dwarves|Dwarf]] | name=Fundin | image=The Lord of the Rings Online - Fundin.jpg | caption=Fundin in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Lonely Mountain]] | affiliation= | language=[[Khuzdul]] | birth={{TA|2662}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{TA|2799}} | deathlocation=[[Azanulbizar]] | age=137 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Durin]] | parentage=[[Farin]] | siblings=[[Gróin]] | spouse= | children=[[Balin]], [[Dwalin]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Fundin''' was a [[Dwarves|dwarf]] of the royal line of [[Durin's folk]], the great-grandson of King [[Náin II]]. He was the son of [[Farin]] and the older brother of [[Gróin]]. ==History== Fundin was most likely born in the [[Lonely Mountain]] and went into exile with his people after the attack by the [[Dragons|Dragon]] [[Smaug]]. He fathered two sons, [[Balin]] and [[Dwalin]]. Fundin was killed beneath the [[East-gate of Moria]] in the [[Battle of Azanulbizar]], the final conflict of the [[War of the Dwarves and Orcs]]: He was part of the first assault of the vanguard that was thrown back with loss, and was driven into a wood by lake [[Mirrormere]]. He was slain there along with his kinsman [[Frerin]], and many others. After the battle his body was burned on a wooden pyre along with the rest of the [[Burned Dwarves|dead]].{{App|Durin}} Years later, his sons, as members of [[Thorin and Company]], were involved with the [[Quest of Erebor|regaining of Lonely Mountain]]. [[Roäc]] recognised Balin as the son of Fundin.{{H|Gathering}} == Etymology == ''Fundin'' is one of the dwarf names found in the ''[[Völuspá]]''.{{HM|AH}}, p. 316 His name means "Found".Chester Nathan Gould, "Dwarf-Names: A Study in Old Icelandic Religion", published in ''Publications of the Modern Language Association of America'', Vol 44 (1929), issue #4, pp. 939-967 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | | NAI | | | | | | | | | | | |NAI=[[Náin II]]

''{{TA|2879|n}} - {{FoA|120}}+''}} {{familytree/end}} ==Portrayal in adaptations== '''2021: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :Fundin appears in an extended flashback depicting the [[Battle of Azanulbizar]], in which he fights alongside his sons [[Balin]] and [[Dwalin]] and the rest of [[Farin]]'s kin. He is slain by arrows while covering the retreat of [[Thráin]]'s vanguard. {{references}} [[Category:Dwarves]] [[Category:Dwarven names]] [[Category:Longbeards]] [[Category:Norse names]] [[Category:Third Age characters]] [[de:Fundin]] [[fi:Fundin]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/nains/3a/fundin]]
